title.rendered: PCB’s Disappointing comments on Raja’s Allegations

content.rendered:
The Pakistan Cricket Board on Wed felt former chief Ramiz Raja numerous allegations against the board. Najam Sethi, the newly appointed Chairman of the managing committee framed the comments as ‘disappointing’. (Read Also: Celebration of Double ton costs sudden injury to David Warner)

“The Pakistan Cricket Board has expressed disappointment over the comments created by ex-Chairman Mr. Ramiz Raja against the PCB Chairman. Mr. Najam Sethi on a social media platform and in an exceedingly TV interview. The PCB believes former Chairman Mr. Raja’s comments are geared toward tarnishing and damaging the impeccable name of Mr. Sethi. It reserves its rights to pursue legal proceedings to safeguard and defend the image of its chairman and the institution.” a press release given by the board revealed.

Countering Raja’s allegations that he wasn’t even allowed to require his belongings. The PCB release stated, “PCB Chief operative Officer Mr. Salman Naseer has already rebutted Mr. Raja’s allegations that he was not allowed to gather his belongings by confirming these were picked up in person by him by Wednesday. As an area of the same old handing and seizing process. Mr. Raja was ne’er stopped from coming into the leader construction premises. He is welcome and free to go to any time in the future.”

Pakistan was painted for the first time reception after England managed to wash the three-match test series this month. The team is presently enjoying a two-Test series against New Zealand at home.
